items.title: Wildfire Urgency Unites Congress. The ‘Fix Our Forests’ Act Does Not.
items.description: Lawmakers from both parties agreed at a congressional hearing Tuesday that the federal government must act to address the growing threat of catastrophic wildfires, but they were sharply divided over how, and whether pending legislation known as the Fix Our Forests Act offers the right path forward.  The House of Representatives passed the FOFA legislation […]

items.title: NYC Congestion Pricing Is Improving Air Quality, but Trump Pushback Threatens Its Future
items.description: Just over a year ago, New York City implemented a first-in-the-nation “congestion pricing” program to reduce traffic, fund public transit work and improve air quality by raising tolls for drivers coming into Manhattan’s major hubs.  Now some of the early results are in—and experts are giving it top marks. items.title: Composting Fines for Buildings Are Back on in New York City
items.description: In 2024, New York City’s Department of Sanitation rolled out a mandatory curbside organics collection program, aiming to reduce landfill waste and cut methane emissions by allowing residents to set out their food scraps once a week for collection and composting. items.title: As the Arctic Grows Noisier, Narwhals Are Becoming Quieter
items.description: For most of their evolutionary history, narwhals have relied more on sound than sight to survive in the Arctic’s dark icy waters. items.title: ‘Toxic Colonialism’ on the Bay of Bengal
items.description: Every day along the coast of Sitakunda, Bangladesh, the earth recoils without warning.
